To prouoke all sorts hereunto, is the maine project propounded in this present discourse. Which (what euer it be; and I wish it were much better;) I humbly present to your Ladiship, desiring that it may helpe to supply some part of that dutie and seruice, which partly mine owne infirmitie and imbecillitie of bodie, and partly also other necessarie and vnauoidable imployments, will not suffer me to performe answerably to mine owne desire, and mine Honorable Lords and your Ladiships desert. And so wishing againe and againe vnto your Ladiship, (for what other, or what better thing can I wish?) that which the worke
it selfe importeth, true Contentment from God in this life, and full Contentment with God after this life; I take my leaue for the present, but cease not to continue
